Technical gateway enabling tailored insurance solutions for digital and physical asset owners. Connects insurance providers with digital citizens and the Web3 world, offering coverage for digital assets including Travel NFTs that simplify travel by consolidating itinerary details, flights, accommodations, and experiences in secure digital tokens.

Travel-security and crisis-monitoring service provider that develops and operates early warning, information and communication systems for business and leisure travellers and organisations. Covers global travel risks including political unrest, natural disasters, strikes and epidemics. Based in Hamburg, Germany.

Non-profit organization based in Zug, Switzerland, established to drive the development of a blockchain-based ecosystem tailored for the global travel industry. Aims to enhance efficiency and sustainability through collaborative practices and web3 technologies.

Canada's flag carrier and largest airline. Founded in 1937 as Trans-Canada Air Lines and renamed to Air Canada in 1965. Operates an extensive domestic and international network with hubs in Montréal, Toronto, and Vancouver, and is a founding member of Star Alliance.

One of the world's largest consolidators of airline tickets, providing full-service solutions for travel agencies, tour operators, and online portals. Offers innovative booking technology and access to a vast array of flight content from over 100 countries.
Travel technology company providing innovative solutions for the travel industry.

Leading association representing the German travel industry, advocating for the interests of tour operators, travel agencies, and service providers. Serves as a central point of contact for political institutions, media, and the public on all travel-related matters. Represents over 4,000 member companies.

Greek flag carrier airline and the largest airline in Greece. Founded in 1987, it operates scheduled and charter flights to destinations throughout Europe and the Middle East. Member of the Star Alliance since 2010.

Travel technology and services company providing innovative solutions for the travel industry. Offers software development, digital platforms, and consulting services tailored to travel agencies and tour operators, helping them optimize their business operations and digital presence.

International travel conglomerate headquartered in Cologne, Germany. Originally founded as Deutsche Reisebüro (DER) in 1917, became DERTOUR Group in 2013 as part of REWE Group. Operates over 130 travel agencies, tour operators, booking portals, and hotel companies across 16 European countries.

British multinational low-cost airline group and one of the largest airlines in Europe by passenger numbers. Founded in 1995, EasyJet operates an extensive European route network and is known for its low-cost carrier model.
Norwegian tour operator providing travel packages and vacation services.
German low-cost airline and subsidiary of Lufthansa Group, specializing in European and international leisure routes.
German tour operator specializing in mountain and sea vacation packages. The name translates to 'Mountains and Sea'.

Finnish flag carrier airline and one of the oldest airlines in the world still operating under its original name, founded in 1923. Known for connecting Europe with Asia via its northern route network.

Digital travel platform offering comprehensive hotel reviews, ratings, and booking services for package tours, hotels, and car rentals. Operates extensive hotel rating and travel booking portals, as well as the tour operator brand HolidayCheck Reisen. Also manages car rental portals MietwagenCheck and Driveboo.

Travel technology company providing software solutions and digital platforms for the travel industry. Offers booking systems, travel management software, and technology services to help travel agencies and tour operators streamline their operations and enhance customer experiences.

German scheduled and executive charter airline with headquarters in Dreieich, founded in 1994. Originally an intra-German airline based at Frankfurt-Hahn Airport, Hahn Air has evolved into a leading provider of distribution services for other airlines and ticketing solutions for travel agencies. Since 1999, the company connects over 350 partner airlines and 100,000 travel agencies across 190 markets, providing insolvency-safe HR-169 ticketing solutions through its IATA prefix code 169. Hahn Air operates a fleet of business jets and offers comprehensive travel distribution services including GDS integration, BSP participation, and Securtix insolvency protection.

Leading hotel content management and distribution platform serving the travel industry. Provides comprehensive solutions for managing multilingual hotel descriptions, images, and multimedia content, distributing hotel information to travel agencies, tour operators, and online booking channels worldwide.

German travel company specializing in low-cost holiday packages and flights. Offers affordable travel deals including last-minute offers, city trips, and package holidays combining flights and hotel accommodations. Focuses on providing cost-effective travel options primarily targeting the German-speaking market.
Travel technology platform providing innovative solutions for the travel industry.

Leading Central European online travel agency offering a wide range of travel services including package holidays, flights, and hotel bookings. Operates across multiple European countries, providing customers with convenient booking platforms and comprehensive travel options. Part of the Invia Group, one of the largest online travel companies in Central Europe.
German flag carrier airline and one of the largest airlines in Europe, known for its crane logo symbolizing precision and reliability.

Swiss travel group founded in 1935 by Gottlieb Duttweiler as a cooperative to enable affordable holidays. Over the decades it has grown into an international travel-group specialising in leisure and business travel. The group comprises various brands across Europe and was acquired by the DERTOUR Group in 2025 (excluding its Interhome vacation-home unit).

Air broker and ticket issuer that purchases flight quotas from various providers and airlines, offering them at attractive prices. Bookings are available through tour operators, booking platforms, or directly via their homepage, primarily focusing on charter flights. Provides airline consulting services including flight operations, network planning, and revenue management.

Qatari flag carrier airline based in Doha, Qatar. One of the world's leading airlines, known for its modern fleet, extensive global network, and premium service. Part of the oneworld alliance and operates one of the youngest fleets in the industry.
German tour operator offering travel packages and vacation experiences.

Australian flag carrier airline and one of the oldest continuously operating airlines in the world, founded in 1920. The name Qantas is an acronym for 'Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services'. Known as 'The Flying Kangaroo' and Australia's largest airline.
Irish low-cost airline and one of the largest airlines in Europe by passenger numbers. Known for its ultra-low-cost carrier model and extensive European route network.

Europe's largest medium-sized, independent, and owner-operated tourism distribution company. Provides comprehensive services for travel agencies, uniting various aspects of tourism under one roof. Offers booking systems, travel agency software, and a network for independent travel agencies. Family business now in its second generation.
Web3 hotel-booking platform allowing users to search over 1 million hotels and pay with 200+ cryptocurrencies or credit cards. Integrates blockchain and NFT utilities for travel rewards.

Global mobility service provider offering vehicle rentals, car sharing, ride-hailing, and subscription services. One of the world's leading car rental companies, operating in over 110 countries with a diverse fleet ranging from economy to luxury vehicles. Provides mobility solutions for both individual and corporate customers.

World's leading online travel agency and accommodation booking platform, offering millions of properties worldwide including hotels, apartments, vacation rentals, and more. Part of Booking Holdings Inc., providing travelers with comprehensive booking services, reviews, and travel deals across the globe.

Major global online travel platform offering flights, hotels, vacation packages, car rentals, cruises, and activities. Part of Expedia Group, one of the world's largest online travel companies, serving millions of travelers with comprehensive booking services and travel deals across hundreds of countries.

Leading global online travel agency providing comprehensive travel services including flights, hotels, trains, car rentals, and vacation packages. Operates in multiple markets worldwide, offering competitive prices and extensive travel options for both business and leisure travelers.

World's largest tourism group, operating as a vertically integrated travel company offering package holidays, flights, hotels, cruises, and destination services. Combines tour operations, airlines, hotels, cruise ships, and retail travel agencies to provide comprehensive travel experiences across Europe and beyond.

International travel deals platform that finds and shares discounted hotels, flights, travel packages, and other travel services. Operates across 10 countries in Europe and North America, curating hand-picked deals from various travel providers and reaching over 20 million consumers monthly through editorial teams worldwide.

Major U.S. airline and one of the world's largest airlines, headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Founded in 1925, Delta operates over 5,400 flights daily to 325 destinations in 52 countries. Known for its extensive domestic and international network, premium service, and industry-leading safety record. A founding member of the SkyTeam alliance and one of the oldest operating commercial airlines in the United States.

Major U.S. airline and the largest airline in the world in terms of passengers carried and daily flights. Founded in 1926, American Airlines operates an extensive network with nearly 6,800 flights per day to over 350 destinations across more than 60 countries. Headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas, and a founding member of the Oneworld alliance, the airline serves millions of passengers annually with a comprehensive domestic and international route network.

Flag carrier airline of the Netherlands and the world's oldest continuously operating scheduled airline still using its original name. Founded in 1919, KLM operates flights to over 170 destinations across 63 countries from its hub at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol. A member of the SkyTeam alliance and part of the Air France-KLM Group, KLM combines Dutch heritage with modern aviation services, serving millions of passengers annually with a fleet of over 100 aircraft.

Major American international airline and one of the largest airlines in the world. Founded in 1926, United Airlines operates extensive domestic and international routes across the United States and to destinations on six continents, serving over 175 million passengers annually to more than 350 destinations. Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, United is a founding member of the Star Alliance and operates one of the most comprehensive route networks in the aviation industry.

One of the two flag carriers of the United Arab Emirates and the world's largest long-haul airline, operating more than 3,600 flights per week to over 150 cities in 80 countries across six continents. Founded in 1985 and based in Dubai, Emirates operates a fleet of over 250 aircraft from its hub at Dubai International Airport. The airline is also the world's third-largest by scheduled revenue passenger-kilometers flown and operates cargo services through Emirates SkyCargo, making it one of the most prominent airlines in the Middle East and globally.

World's largest purpose-led adventure travel company, offering over 1,000 escorted tours across all seven continents in more than 120 countries. Founded in 1989, Intrepid specializes in small group tours led by local guides, using public transport and staying at locally owned accommodations. The company is a certified B Corporation and has been carbon neutral since 2010, operating through multiple brands including Intrepid Travel, Urban Adventures, Peregrine Adventures, and Intrepid DMC.

Crypto-native travel booking platform founded in 2017 that enables users to book hotels, flights, and activities using cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. Offers access to over 2.2 million properties across 230 countries, 400,000+ activities, and 600+ airlines globally. Accepts over 100 leading cryptocurrencies alongside traditional payment methods, with users earning rewards through the AVA Smart Program. The platform incorporates next-generation blockchain technology and tokenized incentives to create a frictionless booking experience aligned with decentralized principles.
